homura.utils package¶

Submodules¶

homura.utils.benchmarks module¶

homura.utils.benchmarks.timeit(func: Optional[Callable] = None, num_iters: Optional[int] = 100, warmup_iters: Optional[int] = None)[source]¶

A simple

>>> @timeit(num_iters=100, warmup_iters=100)
>>> def mm(a, b):
>>>     return a @ b
[homura.utils.benchmarks|2019-11-24 06:40:46|INFO] f requires 0.000021us per iteration

homura.utils.containers module¶

class homura.utils.containers.Map(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: collections.abc.MutableMapping, dict

dict like object but: stored values can be subscribed and attributed.

>>> m = Map(test="test")
>>> m.test is m["test"]
copy() → a shallow copy of D[source]¶
deepcopy()[source]¶

Move stored tensors to a given device

Tuple for tensors.

class homura.utils.containers.StepDict(_type, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: dict

Dictionary with step, state_dict, load_state_dict. Intended to be used with Optimizer, lr_scheduler

homura.utils.reproducibility module¶

homura.utils.reproducibility.set_deterministic(seed: Optional[int] = None)[source]¶

Set seed of torch, random and numpy to seed for making it deterministic. Because of CUDA’s limitation, this does not make everything deterministic, however.

homura.utils.reproducibility.set_seed(seed: Optional[int] = None)[source]¶

Fix seed of random generator in the given context. Negative seed has no effect

>>> with set_seed(0):
>>>     do_some_random_thing()
